item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：苹果计划三年内推出调制解调器与高通竞争
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五报道，苹果公司正准备在明年推出其期待已久的蜂窝调制解调器芯片系列，这些芯片将取代长期合作伙伴高通公司的组件。【原文：Apple is preparing to launch its long-awaited series of cellular modem chips next year, which will replace components from longtime partner Qualcomm , Bloomberg News reported on Friday.】

item.title: 法院对 TikTok 作出不利裁决后，TikTok 下一步会怎么做？
item.description: 美国联邦上诉法院周五作出裁决，支持维持要求中国字节跳动公司在明年初之前剥离其在美国的流行短视频应用 TikTok，否则将面临禁令的法律。【原文：A U.S. federal appeals court ruled on Friday in favor of upholding a law requiring China-based ByteDance to divest its popular short video app TikTok in the United States by early next year or face a ban.】

item.title: 两名美国参议员寻求对 DraftKings 和 FanDuel 进行反垄断调查
item.description: 两名美国参议员要求联邦贸易委员会和司法部调查在线博彩平台 DraftKings 和 FanDuel，因为他们担心这两家公司正在协调打击竞争对手。【原文：Two U.S senators have asked the Federal Trade Commission and Justice Department to investigate online betting platforms DraftKings and FanDuel over concerns they are coordinating against competitors.】

item.title: 美联储哈马克表示，放缓降息的时机可能已经到来
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）周五在她的首次重要政策演讲中表示，在央行下一次政策会议上，她将保持开放的选择，因为更广泛的经济状况继续证明降息步伐应该放缓。【原文：In her first major policy speech, Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said on Friday she’s keeping her options open when it comes to the central bank’s next policy meeting, as broader economic conditions continue to argue for a slowdown in the pace of rate cuts.】

item.title: 汇丰银行预计标准普尔 500 指数到 2025 年底将达到 6700 点
item.description: 汇丰银行周五表示，由于企业盈利增长强劲和美国经济具有活力，预计到2025年底，S&P 500指数将达到6700点。【原文：Brokerage HSBC said on Friday it expects the S&P 500 index to hit 6,700 by the end of 2025, on the back of robust corporate earnings growth and a resilient U.S. economy.】

item.title: 独家新闻消息人士称，特朗普可能取消美国邮政局电动邮车合同
item.description: 据三位熟悉该计划的消息人士透露，唐纳德-特朗普的过渡团队正在考虑取消美国邮政局的送货车队电气化合同，作为针对电动汽车的更广泛行政命令的一部分。【原文：Donald Trump's transition team is considering canceling the United States Postal Service's contracts to electrify its delivery fleet, as part of a broader suite of executive orders targeting electric vehicles, according to three sources familiar with the plans.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院对 TikTok 重大裁决的主要引文
item.description: 美国联邦上诉法院周五维持了一项可能迫使中国字节跳动公司在美国销售其短视频应用 TikTok 的法律。以下是这一重大裁决中的一些关键段落，该裁决驳回了有关该法律将侵犯美国宪法第一修正案言论自由保护的主张。【原文：A U.S. federal appeals court on Friday upheld a law that could force China-based ByteDance to sell its short video app TikTok in the United States. Here is a look at some of the key passages from the blockbuster ruling, which rejected claims that the law will infringe the U.S. Constitution’s First Amendment speech protections.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼担忧通胀，呼吁谨慎降息
item.description: 美联储理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）周五表示，经济面临的通胀风险依然真实存在，劳动力市场数据也难以解读，这预示着央行在做出进一步降息决定时将持谨慎态度。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said on Friday that inflation risks to the economy remain real and labor market data hard to interpret, and that augurs caution with further decisions on central bank rate cuts.】

item.title: 独家报道文件显示，瑞士信贷员工使用 WhatsApp 的情况受到英国监管机构的审查
item.description: 路透社看到的文件显示，英国金融行为监管局正在调查关于瑞士信贷前雇员通过 WhatsApp 消息平台共享机密信息的指控。【原文：The UK's Financial Conduct Authority is scrutinising allegations that some former Credit Suisse employees shared confidential information over the WhatsApp messaging platform, documents seen by Reuters show.】

item.title: 马斯克斥资超过 25 亿美元帮助特朗普当选
item.description: 根据新的文件显示，埃隆-马斯克花费了超过 25 亿美元帮助唐纳德-特朗普赢得 11 月的总统大选，这凸显了世界上最富有的人之一对今年白宫竞选的影响。【原文：Elon Musk spent over a quarter of a billion dollars to help Donald Trump win November's presidential election, according to new filings, underscoring the influence one of the world's wealthiest people had on this year's White House race.】

item.title: Lululemon 股价大涨，假日需求助推业绩预测和业绩增长
item.description: 周五早盘，Lululemon Athletica 股价大涨约 17%，原因是乐观的年度业绩预期提升了投资者对强劲假日季度的乐观情绪，并促使华尔街对该公司股票持更加看涨的观点。【原文：Lululemon Athletica shares jumped about 17% in early trading on Friday as an upbeat annual forecast raised investor optimism for a robust holiday quarter and prompted Wall Street to take a more bullish view on the stock.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Blackstone、EQT 已进入下一轮 Urbaser 出售程序
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，收购集团 Blackstone 和 EQT 已进入废物管理公司 Urbaser 出售程序的第二轮竞标。【原文：Buyout groups Blackstone and EQT have advanced to the second round of bids in the sale process of waste management company Urbaser, according to two sources with knowledge of the situation.】

item.title: 沃尔玛、亚马逊假日消费增长，塔吉特、百思买步履维艰 - 数据
item.description: 消费数据显示，沃尔玛公司、亚马逊公司以及快速增长的电子商务网站Shein和PDD Holding旗下的Temu在 "黑色星期五 "和 "网络星期一 "的销售额均创下历史新高，这表明它们在假日季结束时的表现可能会比陷入困境的塔吉特和百思买强劲得多。【原文：Walmart Inc , Amazon.com and fast-growing e-commerce sites Shein and PDD Holding's Temu saw record-breaking sales on Black Friday and Cyber Monday, according to spending data, suggesting that they may finish the holiday season on a much stronger note than Target and Best Buy , which struggled.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院支持强制出售 TikTok 的法律
item.description: 美国联邦上诉法院周五维持了一项法律，要求中国字节跳动公司在明年初之前剥离其在美国的流行短视频应用 TikTok，否则将面临禁令。【原文：A U.S. federal appeals court on Friday upheld a law requiring Chinese-based ByteDance to divest its popular short video app TikTok in the United States by early next year or face a ban.】

item.title: 美国联邦储蓄委员会起诉 Comerica 银行，指控其辜负美国残疾人和老年人的利益
item.description: 美国消费者金融监督机构周五宣布，地区性贷款机构康美药业银行（Comerica Bank）被指控系统性地虐待了数百万残疾和老年客户，并可能根据新的民事执法行动支付罚金。【原文：Regional lender Comerica Bank faces allegations it systematically mistreated millions of mostly disabled and elder customers and could pay penalties under new civil enforcement action, the U.S. watchdog agency for consumer finance announced Friday.】

item.title: 高盛退出全球银行气候联盟
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）表示，它已经退出了一个旨在使银行贷款和投资活动与全球应对气候变化的努力保持一致的行业联盟，这是美国金融公司最近一次高调退出该组织。【原文：Goldman Sachs said it has quit a sector coalition aimed at aligning bank lending and investment activities with global efforts to fight climate change, marking the latest high-profile departure of a U.S. financial firm from the group.】

item.title: 消息人士称育碧股东正就可能的收购条款进行谈判
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，育碧娱乐公司（Ubisoft Entertainment SA）的股东正在考虑如何在不削弱创始家族控制权的情况下，安排对这家《刺客信条》视频游戏制造商的可能收购。【原文：Shareholders of Ubisoft Entertainment SA are considering how to structure a possible buyout of the Assassin's Creed video game maker without reducing the founding family's control, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国 11 月就业人数显示就业增长在 10 月小幅下滑后有所加快
item.description: 在受到飓风和罢工的严重制约之后，美国 11 月份的就业增长猛增，但这可能并不意味着劳动力市场状况发生了实质性转变，劳动力市场状况继续稳步放宽，并为美联储本月再次降息提供了余地。【原文：U.S. job growth surged in November after being severely constrained by hurricanes and strikes, but probably does not signal a material shift in labor market conditions that continue to ease steadily and gives the Federal Reserve leeway to cut interest rates again this month.】

item.title: 美国 11 月就业增长加速；失业率升至 4.2
item.description: 美国的就业增长在受到飓风和罢工的严重制约后，于11月出现了猛增，但这可能并不意味着劳动力市场状况发生了实质性转变，劳动力市场继续稳步放宽，并允许美联储在本月再次降息。【原文：U.S. job growth surged in November after being severely constrained by hurricanes and strikes, but this probably does not signal a material shift in labor market conditions that continue to ease steadily and allows the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates again this month.】

item.title: 加拿大 11 月失业率跃升至 6.8%，创近 8 年新高
item.description: 周五的数据显示，尽管加拿大经济净增了50,500个就业岗位，但11月份加拿大失业率仍超乎预期地升至6.8%，创下除大流行病时期外的近八年新高，这可能会增加下周大幅降息的可能性。【原文：Canada's unemployment rate rose more than expected to 6.8% in November, a near-eight-year high excluding the pandemic years, even as the economy added a net 50,500 jobs, data showed on Friday, likely boosting chances of a large interest rate cut next week.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：OpenAI 寻求通过放弃与微软的 "AGI "条款来释放投资
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周五援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道称，OpenAI 正在讨论放弃一项规定，即当这家初创公司实现 "人工通用智能 "时，微软将被排除在其最先进的模型之外，因为该公司正寻求获得数十亿美元的未来投资。【原文：OpenAI is in discussions to ditch a provision that shuts Microsoft out of its most advanced models when the start-up achieves "artificial general intelligence", as it seeks to unlock billions of dollars of future investment, the Financial Times reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 消息人士称英伟达的商业行为成为欧盟反垄断关注的焦点
item.description: 直接知情人士透露，欧盟反垄断监管机构正在询问英伟达的竞争对手和客户，这家美国人工智能芯片制造商捆绑其产品是否会给自己带来不公平的优势，此举可能会导致正式调查。【原文：EU antitrust regulators are asking Nvidia rivals and customers if the U.S. artificial intelligence chipmaker bundles its products that may give it an unfair advantage, people with direct knowledge of the matter said, in a move that may lead to a formal investigation.】

item.title: 普京颁布天然气支付令后，卢布对美元汇率反弹突破 100
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京颁布了一项法令，为俄罗斯天然气的欧洲买家提供了新的支付选择，从而使外汇流动得以恢复，此后俄罗斯卢布兑美元汇率反弹突破 100，周五报 99.50。【原文：The Russian rouble rebounded past 100 to the U.S. dollar, trading at 99.50 on Friday, after a decree by President Vladimir Putin which opened new payment options for European buyers of Russian gas, allowing foreign currency flows to resume.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称英国石油公司为美国天然气管道系统股份寻找买家
item.description: 四位知情人士透露，英国石油公司（BP）正在为其美国天然气管道网络的股份寻找买家。【原文：BP is seeking buyers for a stake in its U.S. natural gas pipeline network, four people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: WH 集团获股东批准分拆史密斯菲尔德食品公司并在美国上市
item.description: 总部设在香港的世界最大猪肉生产商 WH 集团周五表示，其股东已批准将史密斯菲尔德食品公司分拆为一家美国上市公司。【原文：Hong Kong-based WH Group , the world's largest pork producer, said on Friday that its shareholders had approved spinning off Smithfield Foods into a listed company in the United States.】

item.title: 美国经济增长乐观，美国股票基金连续第五周吸引资金流入
item.description: 截至11月4日，美国投资者连续第五周抢购股票基金，原因是华尔街主要股指反弹、对经济强劲增长的乐观情绪以及对美联储本月连续第三次降息的预期。【原文：U.S. investors snapped up equity funds for a fifth successive week through Nov. 4, motivated by a rally in Wall Street's main indexes, optimism for strong economic growth, and expectations of a third consecutive Federal Reserve rate cut this month.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息称瓦罗能源公司正在洽谈收购 Preem 在瑞典的炼油厂
item.description: 四位业内消息人士告诉路透社，欧洲能源公司 Varo Energy 正在洽谈收购 Preem 在瑞典的两家炼油厂，押注于日益增长的低碳生物燃料需求。【原文：European energy firm Varo Energy is in talks to acquire Preem's two Swedish refineries in a bet on growing demand for low-carbon biofuels, four industry sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 早间交易长债收益率在非农数据公布前回落，法国反弹
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 特朗普的 NASA人选是 SpaceX 的福音，但将面临政治挑战
item.description: 贾里德-艾萨克曼（Jared Isaacman）是航天工业中以商业为核心的快速发展的核心人物。【原文：Jared Isaacman is a central figure of a speedy, commercial-focused side of the space industry.】

item.title: 美联储发言人最后名单应在会前封锁开始前公布
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会官员在 12 月 17 日至 18 日的会议前将进入平静期，预计新的就业数据将从 10 月份的疲软读数中反弹，而且官员们越来越感觉到劳动力市场仍处于稳健状态。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve officials head into the quiet period ahead of their Dec. 17-18 meeting with new jobs numbers expected to show a rebound from the weak reading in October and a growing sense among officials that the labor market remains in solid shape.】
